trans-unit.source: Using the SMTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the SMTP Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the SMTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the SMTP Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Connect to a SMTP server and send email, including emails with attachments.
trans-unit.target: Connect to a SMTP server and send email, including emails with attachments.

trans-unit.source: SMTP connector "Send Email" action lets you send email to the specified email address(es).
trans-unit.target: SMTP connector "Send Email" action lets you send email to the specified email address(es).

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of a workflow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of a workflow.

trans-unit.source: You can add the SMTP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the SMTP Connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Triggers are events that happen.
trans-unit.target: Triggers are events that happen.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or when a new customer is added.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result of the trigger.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result of the trigger.

trans-unit.source: For example, when an order is updated or a new customer is added, send an email to the new customer.
trans-unit.target: For example, when an order is updated or a new customer is added, send an email to the new customer.

trans-unit.source: The SMTP Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The SMTP Connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: Currently, there are no triggers for this connector.
trans-unit.target: Currently, there are no triggers for this connector.

trans-unit.source: The SMTP Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The SMTP Connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: Send email
trans-unit.target: Send email

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Select API Apps and search for “SMTP Connector”.
trans-unit.target: Select API Apps and search for “SMTP Connector”.

trans-unit.source: Create the connector.
trans-unit.target: Create the connector.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following package settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following package settings:

trans-unit.source: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- User Name | Yes | Enter a user name that can connect to the SMTP server.
trans-unit.target: Name | Required | Description --- | --- | --- User Name | Yes | Enter a user name that can connect to the SMTP server.

trans-unit.source: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.
trans-unit.target: Password | Yes | Enter the user name password.

trans-unit.source: Server Address | Yes | Enter the SMTP Server name or IP address.
trans-unit.target: Server Address | Yes | Enter the SMTP Server name or IP address.

trans-unit.source: Server Port | Yes | Enter SMTP Server port number.
trans-unit.target: Server Port | Yes | Enter SMTP Server port number.

trans-unit.source: Enable SSL | No | Enter true to use SMTP over a secure SSL/TLS channel.
trans-unit.target: Enable SSL | No | Enter true to use SMTP over a secure SSL/TLS channel.

trans-unit.source: Select Create.
trans-unit.target: Select Create.

trans-unit.source: Once your connector is created, you can now use the SMTP connector as an action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your connector is created, you can now use the SMTP connector as an action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: Create a new Logic App: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Create a new Logic App: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Open Triggers and Actions to open the Logic Apps designer and configure your workflow:
trans-unit.target: Open Triggers and Actions to open the Logic Apps designer and configure your workflow:

trans-unit.source: The SMTP connector is listed in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.
trans-unit.target: The SMTP connector is listed in the “API Apps in this resource group” section in the gallery on the right hand side.

trans-unit.source: Select it: <linkText></linkText>
trans-unit.target: Select it: <linkText></linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select the SMTP Connector to automatically add it to the workflow designer.
trans-unit.target: Select the SMTP Connector to automatically add it to the workflow designer.

trans-unit.source: You can now configure the SMTP connector to use in your workflow.
trans-unit.target: You can now configure the SMTP connector to use in your workflow.

trans-unit.source: Select the Send Email action and configure the input properties:
trans-unit.target: Select the Send Email action and configure the input properties:

trans-unit.source: Property
trans-unit.target: Property

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: To
trans-unit.target: To

trans-unit.source: Enter the email address of recipient(s).
trans-unit.target: Enter the email address of recipient(s).

trans-unit.source: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).
trans-unit.target: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).

trans-unit.source: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.

trans-unit.source: Cc
trans-unit.target: Cc

trans-unit.source: Enter the email address of the carbon copy recipient(s).
trans-unit.target: Enter the email address of the carbon copy recipient(s).

trans-unit.source: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).
trans-unit.target: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).

trans-unit.source: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.

trans-unit.source: Subject
trans-unit.target: Subject

trans-unit.source: Enter the subject of the email.
trans-unit.target: Enter the subject of the email.

trans-unit.source: Body
trans-unit.target: Body

trans-unit.source: Enter body of the email.
trans-unit.target: Enter body of the email.

trans-unit.source: Is HTML
trans-unit.target: Is HTML

trans-unit.source: When this property is set to true, the contents of the body are sent as HTML.
trans-unit.target: When this property is set to true, the contents of the body are sent as HTML.

trans-unit.source: Bcc
trans-unit.target: Bcc

trans-unit.source: Enter the email address of recipient(s) for blind carbon copy.
trans-unit.target: Enter the email address of recipient(s) for blind carbon copy.

trans-unit.source: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).
trans-unit.target: Separate multiple email addresses using a semicolon (;).

trans-unit.source: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter: recipient1@domain.com;recipient2@domain.com.

trans-unit.source: Importance
trans-unit.target: Importance

trans-unit.source: Enter the Importance of the email.
trans-unit.target: Enter the Importance of the email.

trans-unit.source: The options are Normal, Low, and High.
trans-unit.target: The options are Normal, Low, and High.

trans-unit.source: Attachments
trans-unit.target: Attachments

trans-unit.source:
Attachments to be sent along with the email. It contains the following fields:
  • Content (String)
  • Content transfer Encoding (Enum) (“none”
trans-unit.target:
Attachments to be sent along with the email. It contains the following fields:
  • Content (String)
  • Content transfer Encoding (Enum) (“none”

trans-unit.source:
”base64”)
  • Content Type (String)
  • Content ID (String)
  • File Name (String)
trans-unit.target:
”base64”)
  • Content Type (String)
  • Content ID (String)
  • File Name (String)

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title>.
